body_html:
Hi
I just started using PyTorch. Up to now I am very happy!

But I work on a remote machine with multiple users and it would be great if I could release all GPU memory after I run my networks. I know that I could kill the python process, but I am looking for a way to keep my process running and free all GPU memory.

Is this feature planned or is there a (hacky) way to get the caching allocator to free everything?
